item.description:
If this change in details means you no longer want to or can't attend please change your RSVP to a NO.

 

This one is without the pooches unfortunately but might be fun ! See flyer here:
http://www.stonehengeusa.com/CandlelightSnowshoeing.html

and more information here:
http://www.stonehengeusa.com/LearnAboutUs.html

snowshoeing during the day:

http://www.stonehengeusa.com/Snowshoeing11.html

This will end up being the 3rd year it didn't make any sense to sign up for this on a Saturday evening because there wasn't enough snow to go snow shoeing.  Yet now that there might finally be some significant snow fall on Friday (2-8-2013) the evening snowshoe event for Saturday (2-9-2013) was all ready full for reservations even before there was any snow on the ground to be worth snowshoeing on and the same for 2-16-2013.  Go figure.  So does anyone have any interest in doing this during the day on Saturday (2-9-2013) when there will likely be some actual snow on the ground to snowshoe on.

During the day admission for renting snowshoes on a first come first served basis is:

Regular Daytime Snowshoeing Rates:
Includes rentals and admission to trails:
Adults: $14.00
Children 12 & Under: $10.00

No rental/bring your own snowshoes:
Adults: $8.00
Children 12 & Under: $5.00

As I will be working I will not be able to attend (Dave Bigelow).  Does anyone have any interest in hosting this or people can just do it as a group by accessing the information on line at the link without a host.  If you want to host let me know and I can set that up for you.

Any adult guest you want to bring should sign up on the meetup site as a member so they will be covered by the liability waiver. A minor would need a written waiver signed by a parent or guardian

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Stonehenge DayTime Snowshoeing Trek
